item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A children's story that can only be enjoyed by children is not a good children's story in the slightest." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In sorrow we must go, but not in despair. Behold! we are not bound for ever to the circles of the world, and beyond them is more than memory." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It would seem that Our Lord finds our desires not too strong, but too weak. We are half-hearted creatures, fooling about with drink and sex and ambition when infinite joy is offered us, like an ignorant child who wants to go on making mud pies in a slum because he cannot imagine what is meant by the offer of a holiday at the sea. We are far too easily pleased." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The Christian does not think God will love us because we are good, but that God will make us good because He loves us." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "We are not necessarily doubting that God will do the best for us; we are wondering how painful the best will turn out to be." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Atheism turns out to be too simple. If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning..." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "To love at all is to be vulnerable. Love anything and your heart will be wrung and possibly broken. If you want to make sure of keeping it intact you must give it to no one, not even an animal. Wrap it carefully round with hobbies and little luxuries; avoid all entanglements. Lock it up safe in the casket or coffin of your selfishness. But in that casket, safe, dark, motionless, airless, it will change. It will not be broken; it will become unbreakable, impenetrable, irredeemable. To love is to be vulnerable." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If you look for truth, you may find comfort in the end; if you look for comfort you will not get either comfort or truth only soft soap and wishful thinking to begin, and in the end, despair." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "There was a boy called Eustace Clarence Scrubb, and he almost deserved it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "She's the sort of woman who lives for others - you can tell the others by their hunted expression." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A young man who wishes to remain a sound atheist cannot be too careful of his reading." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word 'darkness' on the walls of his cell." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "It is when we notice the dirt that God is most present in us; it is the very sign of His presence." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I was with book, as a woman is with child." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If no set of moral ideas were truer or better than any other, there would be no sense in preferring civilised morality to savage morality." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Kathleen add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "[The decay of Logic results from an] untroubled assumption that the particular is real and the universal is not." -- C.S. Lewis
